dojg.description: A particle which makes an adverbial clause, with a verb of saying/thinking/understood after it.
dojg.meaning: (thinking/saying) that ~; because; like; in such a way that ~

examples.japanese: (ksa).幸夫は来年は家が買えると大変喜んでいる。
examples.english: Yukio  is very happy that he can buy a house next year.

examples.japanese: (ksb).博物館は開いているかなと、電話してみた。
examples.english: (internal  monologue): Wondering if the museum is open I called them.

examples.japanese: (ksc).テニスをしようと出かけたら、途中で雨が降ってきた。
examples.english: With  the intention of playing tennis (literally: Thinking that I will play tennis) I  went out, but on my way it started to rain.

examples.japanese: (ksd).父はまだ元気なようだと安心していたが、最近急に弱ってきた。
examples.english: I  felt at ease, thinking that my father still looked healthy, but suddenly he  began to grow weak.

examples.japanese: (kse).外国語の能力は単語から文、文から段落、そして段落から複段落と、伸びていく。
examples.english: Foreign  language proficiency develops from words to sentences, from sentences to  paragraphs, and then from paragraphs to complex paragraphs.

examples.japanese: (a).友達は長い間飼っていた猫が死んでしまったと、悲しがっていた。
examples.english: My  friend looked sad, saying that a cat, which she kept for a long time, had died.

examples.japanese: (b).彼は癌になったかもしれないと心配している。
examples.english: He  is worried that he may have cancer.

examples.japanese: (c).その学生はもうちょっとで百点が取れたのにと、悔しがった。
examples.english: That  student felt chagrined that he could almost get 100 points.

examples.japanese: (d).彼女と会うのもこれが最後かと、寂しかったのです。
examples.english: Thinking  that this would be the last time to see her, I felt lonely.

examples.japanese: (e).変な音がしたなと、外に出てみたが、何でもなかった。
examples.english: Wondering  what the strange noise was, I went outside, but it was nothing.

examples.japanese: (f).僕は今晩は酒を飲むまいと、まっすぐ家に帰った。
examples.english: I  came straight home, thinking that I would not drink tonight.

examples.japanese: (g).年内に論文を仕上げようと、懸命に努力しているところです。
examples.english: Thinking  that I should complete the paper before the end of the year, I am right now  doing my very best.

examples.japanese: (h).彼にお礼を言おうとやって来たのに、ほかのことばかり話して、お礼を言うのを忘れてしまった。
examples.english: I  came here intending to thank him, but I just talked about something else, and  forgot to thank him.

examples.japanese: (i).少しは体にいいだろうと、最近は散歩をしています。
examples.english: I  thought it would make a small improvement to my body, so I am taking walks  these days.

examples.japanese: (j).宿題を忘れたので先生に叱られるかもしれないと、ビクビクしていた。
examples.english: I  forgot my homework so I feared that I might be scolded by my teacher.

## 

- (i){V/Adjective(い/な)}informal
- と(思って/言って)
- Verb of psychology
- 読めると(思って/言って)嬉しがっている
- Someone is happy thinking/saying that s/he can read it
- 面白いと(思って/言って)喜んでいる
- Someone is happy thinking/saying that something is interesting
- 便利だと(思って/言って)嬉しがっている
- Someone is happy thinking/saying that something is convenient
- (ii)Sentence (internal monologue)
- と(思って)
- もう会うまいと、縁を切った
- Thinking that someone would not see someone else, he severed the relationship
- 映画でも見に行こうかなと、出かけた
- Wondering if I should go see a movie I left home
- (iii)Vvolitional
- と(思って/して)
- 食べようと(思って/して)
- Thinking that s/he would eat it
- (iv){V/Adjective(い/な)}informal (conjectural)
- と(思って)
- 来ないだろうと(思って)
- Thinking that s/he might not come
- うまらないかもしれないと(思って)
- Thinking that something might be boring
- 元気だろうと(思って)
- Thinking that someone might be healthy
- (v)NounParticle Noun, …NounParticle Noun
- (そして)NounParticleと(いう{よう/風}に)Verb
- 男は二階、女は一階と(いう{よう/風}に)部屋を分ける
- Someone divides the rooms in such a way that men are placed upstairs and women in the first floor
